sources.title: Edge of Doom (1950)
sources.description: A priest sets out to catch the man who killed one of his colleagues. Watch on RetroFlix.org:  https://retroflix.org/edge-of-doom-1950/

sources.title: Edge Of Doom [ 1950]
sources.description: A priest sets out to catch the man who killed one of his colleagues.

sources.title: Edge of Doom [1950] Dana Andrews, Farley Granger, Joan Evans
sources.description: Edge of Doom is a 1950 black-and-white Film Noir directed by Mark Robson and starring Dana Andrews, Farley Granger, and Joan Evans.    When the film was released, the staff at Variety magazine gave the film a positive review, writing, "A grim, relentless story, considerably offbeat, gives some distinction to Edge of Doom. It is played to the hilt by a good cast and directed with impact by Mark Robson.”   Find out more about ‘Depictions of Religion in 1950’s Film Noir’ here.

metadata.Plot: A poor and alienated young man (Farley Granger) who is driven to murder when a priest refuses to give is deceased mother an expensive funeral. The film explores the crippling poverty that has prevented the youth from marrying or providing his mother with enough comforts, and has led to his crime. Dana Andrews plays the compassionate assistant of the slain priest who brings about the tormented killer's repentance.
metadata.Writer: Charles Brackett, Leo Brady, Ben Hecht
metadata.Actors: Dana Andrews, Farley Granger, Joan Evans
